error.signature: ERROR StatusLogger No Log4j 2 configuration file found
error.regex: (?:No Log4j 2 configuration file found|log4j:WARN No appenders could be found|ERROR StatusLogger)

verdict.summary: Log4j cannot find its configuration file (log4j2.xml, log4j2.properties, or log4j2.yaml) on the classpath. The application will use default ERROR-level logging, missing all important log output.

dead_ends.action: Suppressing the warning by redirecting stderr
dead_ends.why_fails: Hiding the warning means your application runs without proper logging configuration. You lose all application logs, making debugging production issues nearly impossible.

dead_ends.action: Mixing Log4j 1.x configuration (log4j.properties) with Log4j 2.x runtime
dead_ends.why_fails: Log4j 2 does not read Log4j 1.x configuration files by default. The file name and format are different. You need log4j2.xml or log4j2.properties, not log4j.properties.

workarounds.action: Place log4j2.xml in src/main/resources so it is on the classpath at runtime
workarounds.how: 1. Create src/main/resources/log4j2.xml with your logging configuration. 2. Verify it is included in the output JAR/WAR: 'jar tf target/app.jar | grep log4j2'. 3. If using Spring Boot, the file should be in src/main/resources. 4. If running in an IDE, ensure src/main/resources is marked as a resources root.

workarounds.action: Explicitly specify the configuration file location with -Dlog4j.configurationFile
workarounds.how: 1. Add -Dlog4j.configurationFile=/path/to/log4j2.xml to JVM arguments. 2. This overrides classpath-based discovery. 3. Useful when the config file lives outside the JAR (e.g., in a config directory in production). 4. Supports file:// and classpath: URIs.
workarounds.condition: when the config file cannot be on the classpath

leads_to.condition: when the Log4j binding JAR is missing from the classpath along with the config

preceded_by.condition: when a build failure causes resources not to be copied to the output directory

frequently_confused_with.distinction: ClassNotFoundException for Log4j means the Log4j library itself is missing; config error means the library is present but cannot find its configuration file
